reviews.review_msg: He is a very adaptable prof and will generally change a couple things, ex. due dates, grading, when requested and is acceptable. Lectures are based off of pre-lectures so make sure you do those or you will be lost. He gives a lot of homework but it is not super difficult. Midterms are long and slightly difficult but the final is not too bad.
I liked the teaching style. Marking is scary, since tests are super hard, but he then rewards people who really try to figure out test and you get good grade!!

MAN IS AWESOME! He left iclicker out all the time so everyone could change their answer. He wants the highest avg so basically he wants everyone to get the highest marks. He is so kind and appreciative. His accent is ok but he does really care for his students. His exams are fair but long. He always scales up A LOT anyway so most of the time u g

Dr. Stelzer is an amazing lecturer and always cared. It is hard to contact him by email as he is extremely busy with everything, so I suggest you bring up your concerns during office hours as he is genuine and extremely patient. He loves what he does with a passion and exams were fair, if not they were scaled to meet standard; mark only goes up.
Bernd is a great lecturer and was really good at answering student questions. Plus, Cookie Dough (pet rabbit) is bomb.
Crazy hard multiple choice exam questions (due to Covid??) but you can make up in written problems. I totally panicked, but grades turned out OK!
One of the better Profs at SFU. Makes online exams super hard, which is a bit scary but scales them. Lots of powerpoint. Does nice demos and has a cute bunny. Would take class again.

My man Bernd scales so beautifully. Oh you got 35% on that exam? Haha not anymore my friend that's a 55% now. You're at a B+? Nah bro you get an A. Hard course, lectures arent great, but who cares when you got Bernd helping ya out. GOAT

30 online hmwrk Qs due every week. 3 written hmwrks total. 3 pre-lectures per week. Exams are mostly based on tutorials. He's a nice guy but I never understood anything explained in lectures. Study the tutorials for exams and you'll do fine, especially since the tests are scaled quite a bit. You can also replace your worst exam with the your final.

He's a really nice guy, but not a great teacher. Lectures are pretty boring and don't have many hand written examples, but good demos. He's pretty disorganized with the online homework, but gave good intensions on it. Not bad, not great. He also has a cute bunny so that's a bonus.
Good course. I never really liked Physics, but now I feel like I can do it, lol... most exam questions are related to stuff covered during lecture, so just make sure you know that material well.
Really nice guy! Always considered our feedback and cared - tests were really hard but got scaled. Wish I had taken the class in-person...
Great class, despite being online! He brought in demos and lots of examples. Tests were really hard though - he said to prevent cheating, but were scaled. Overall good experience.
First and third midterm were fair. Impossible final exam. Gave the class false hope in the final and it was HEAVILY scaled.

Dr. Stelzer is always ready to help. He made it a point to take student feedback from time to time to make sure that his class was benefitting everyone. The first two midterms were fair but the last midterm and final was very long (but it was heavily scaled). He does a lot of examples in class but the course itself needs quite some practice.
I think he likes teaching and it shows. I used to hate Physics, now I understand and actually don't mind it. The exams are hard but get scaled. Highly recommend taking the class.

Dr. Stelzer is a very nice person but sometimes confuses himself during lectures. The midterms were fine but the time limit made them really difficult. The final was just hard. But he ended up scaling the grades. Tutorials and homework problems were useful so make sure you make use of them. Overall an amazing prof.
Bernd is so dorky and lovable :) Not the most outstanding professor I've ever had, but I also have 0 complaints.

He was a great professor and explained concepts really clearly! His midterms were extremely fair as long as you studied his notes and practice exams. Hes also really accessible outside of class and is super understanding and caring. Overall hes a great professor, and I would definitely take any course with him again.
Hey, I thought this was a fun course

The course ended up much like I expected it. But why throw in a super-hard exam when it gets scaled afterwards anyways? - it fried my brain!! Anyway, he is a good Prof. Enjoyed the lectures and would definitely take another class with him - but please get the exams right!
So Happy! Loved this guy with all the cool gear and gadgets in class.. Wished I could have finished that darn exam. but all good.
What a roller coaster. Reeeeeeeeally tough exam, but fair grading!!! Nice Happy End!

RIP. The final exam was terrible and honestly not expected. The midterms were extremely fair; however, I am not sure why he made the final exam so hard. He is a good guy so do well on the midterms and pray for the final.

He's a nice guy but not the best lecturer. Fair midterms but the final was hard; the written questions weren't problems we were familiarized with through tutorials, mastering, or even written questions so i dont really get the point of those. Also, pre-lecter lec slides were inconsistent & i think we were missing a set of slides near the end

such a fun great course throughout the semester with fair midterms, however, final was the worse i have ever written and i studied for entire week, Questions were out of no where. DONT RECOMMEND UNLESS YOU WANT TO FAIL THE FINAL (40%)
Nice guy but super hard final!!!!!!!!!!

Physics is my worst subject (barely a C in phys100) but he teaches it very clear and well. Lots of examples and demos done in class and he explains the concepts good. Replies to emails fast and will give bonus marks to boost the midterm marks if needed. His tests are fair and there are no trick questions. HW./tutorial/MasteringP are very helpful
Friendly and accessible prof. Class gets scaled in the end. Prelecture quizzes, clicker, online homework is a pain but keeps you busy. I would take another class with him.
He does a lot of experiments and examples in class. I guess, know them well and you will excel... :) LOL
overall fair midterms and okay lecturer. final exam was very hard. i would take another class with him.

Only use the text for clarifying concepts. His notes are enough and the text is overkill. Attend tutorials. Study from written homework, tutorials and lecture examples. Cancel's out your worst lecture if you do better on final and attend tutorials. Has slight accent but you can definitely understand what he's saying. Nice, helpful and caring.

He is a fun prof and does a lot of examples, the only issue was that the midterm was way to long and many people couldn't even finish. Attend tutorials cause they are really helpful. participation matters cause there is clicker questions for marks.

I failed Phys 120 with Jeff Sonier, so I had to retake the class with Stelzer. Gotta say, Sonier can learn lots from Stelzer. Stelzer is friendly and respectful towards his students. Assignments and exams are fair. His kind demeanor makes him easy to approach too
I thought I'd die after midterm-1, but this course turned out much better than I thought!! Chill..

While i thought he did a good job helping out students and caring for us in the course, he and erol basically taught off of the smartphysics slides and did next to no teaching of their own. I found myself constantly learning from online sources and the textbook, i think that they should abandon smartphysics altogether.  Good class overall
Great Prof altogether! Very thorough and accessible! Exam was tough, but class gets scaled. Hope to have him again in the future!
Bernd was fantastic! He and Erol really cared for their students and made sure to provide as many resources to us as possible. I would gladly take a class with this prof again.
All around there for the students, really appreciate his insight and kindness. Seems passionate about his own work as well. Hope to have him in the future.

A very nice and brilliant prof. He relentlessly works out all the details of the proofs and calculations during class, and prepares the final productsstatements in the slides that he leaves on the website. As such his lectures are rather dull, but are essential in understanding the material beyond plug-and-chug.
great prof. great science. particle physics is cool!
Looooooong exam, but pushing through it payed of. I say Yeah!!
i'm so happy!!
easy course
Good class, in QM he used blackboard extensively (almost too much). Exams were fair.
He is good. I managed to get good grade on fair final. Also Marco is great guy.
Bernd is good prof.

I'm honestly surprised he received such high opinions from Phys 120 students, because in 485 it was not great. He only read off his slides and most times one equation took up 50%. Granted, that's not his fault, but chalkboard lectures would have been a lot more helpful in this class. Most days it was a struggle for everyone to stay awake.
pretty good class. Exams are hard, midterms are ok.
Yeah! My best course this year.

Great Prof altogether! This is the first time I felt like I was taken care of at SFU. He is doing lots of experiments in class to explain concepts. The rest is practice, which I did myself happily, knowing I would not be screwed over in the end. Very good experience!
awesome prof he's just so loveable. doesn't teach very well so I learned the whole course material on my own but scales very well

Bernd is a great guy, VERY interested in what he teaches, the only negative that comes from his lectures is that he skims over how to get to equations, not exactly how to use them, and he also tends to move his mouth away from his microphone at times. That is all. Ze force on ze horse. german ja.
really nice guy. his class is fun cuz he does experiments. but he goes over the power point too fast and mumbles sometimes so u cant really understand him. so read the book.midterms r easy.

He is a nice guy but i just didn't enjoy his classes. His tests are pretty hard . only 4 or 5 questions each worth a lot. So you better know the material very well. Understand the experiments he does in class because he takes questions out of them.
Powerpoint lectures, sometimes a bit fast. Lot's of experiments during lectures (fun!). Really nice guy! Enjoyed the ride!

yeah !!!!!!!he is great :))never take 120 with Jeff Sonier , take Bernd instead  and u wont regret :)))hismidterms are easy but final is a bit hrd but if u do every question from the book, u will be really fine . Quizzes are hard but those are worth 5 percent in total. Good job Bernd. I love phy now
Nice guy!, However, The lectures are all powerpoints from the textbook, hard to understand the material. Make sure to get the textbook and study it.
Good lecturer, do not have to read the book! lol...

I failed phys 120 with sonier, but when i took it with stelzer, he made me feel i can do the material. You see a big difference between him and sonier. Just read the textbook and review the homework to do well on his midterms and finals
I also took that class last fall but failed badly. Now I feel I can do it. I think he is good Prof!
Great attitude! Likes doing practical examples.
O M G! QUIZZES are so damn hard. and his lectures are totally useless just like reading a textbook? It can be forgiven by easy exams
I hope his exams are not hard!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Lecture is very boring and useless... Feels like your money is wasted having to take this class. It also seems like he doesn't know what he is doing at all! Overall he is a good guy and is trying hard.
